page.title: 06Canal Fishing
page.content: "The best fish you can catch in the Leeds_Liverpool Canal is the tench.It is golden green and has a dorsal fin, it is also extremely slimy and almost impossible to hold.The slimiest of all is the eel,if you even touch one of these it will find some way of escaping from your grasp.Other fish in the canal include perch,roach,bream pike and sometimes even carp. The depth of the canal varies from about 6ft in the middle to about 3ft at the sides.There is usually a spot in one stretch of water where there will be an extremely good shoal of fish.Never leave a rod unattended or a small fish might take the bait then a 6lb pike might take the fish and dislodge the rod aswell." Kenny Madine.
